songs.preamble:
Pumped up kicks is a hard song to like as a high-schooler. But it's a bop. It's got that whistled bit. The video has so many people vibing. The frisbee air-bounce. There's a meme comparing it to 夜に駆ける (yoru ni kakeru). However, that's not the Japanese song that pumped up kicks is like. Telecaster b-boy is that song.
I learned the song as a DDR map that has some fun twists and a quirky video. Then I started to listen to it casually. And I thought I knew what it meant: some sort of romance ending or something about some enigmatic television anchor or something.
After a quick google search, I realized that I was horrendously wrong. So horrendously wrong that I despaired for a day, convincing myself that my interpretation was one of many. But now I'm much more certain that I know what the song is about. But there's a lot of details that are... hard. And there are many versions of the song that you can find, each of which is fun to listen to and some are interesting interpretations of the original.

name.english: Rock n' roll, the morning light falls on you

name.japanese: 転がる岩、君に朝が降る

songs.preamble: The ending of Bocchi the rock hits hard. I mean, here's a spoiler-laced reaction video that resonates with me. But one thing that stuck with me is the song. After learning about the connection to Asian Kung-fu Generation, I became a fan -- the world world world album is great, 君の街まで slaps, and Re:re: has been stuck in my head since erased anyway.

songs.preamble: I wasn't the biggest fan of this song until I understood the lyrics. But the movie it's from is great. And the scene it is from is one of the best. (Which I can't find on YouTube T_T so here's a PV.) Reincarnation love songs FTW. Also the lyrics here are for the original, not the movie version.

english:
At last have you opened your eyes?
Well then why won't you even look me in the eye?
"You're late," you shouted at me,
well I hurried as much as I could,
my heart left my body to come over here.

Your hair or your irises tighten my chest.
Breathing together, I don't want to leave.
This voice I've known forever,
meeting you for the first time, what should I even say?

From you last-last-last life I've been looking for you.
That innocent laugh led me here.
Even if every piece of you disappeared, or was scattered everywhere,
I won't waver, I'll start over,
even restart the universe.

Where to start? The story while you were dreaming.
What billion years, what trillion years. That is the story I've come to tell.
But now seeing to reflected in my eyes.

I want to play and know a you you don't know.
I want to love you even the pain you feel.
This hand I've met across galaxies,
how to hold it without breaking it?

From you last-last-last life I've been looking for you.
That loud voice and your tears led me here.
On this eve of our revelution, who can even stop us now?
I won't waver, I'll claim your heart,
because you stole my way to give up.

Will we pass the invisible barriers ahead?
I think us two, will make it through laughing at the end.
I don't need another weapon except for you.

From you last-last-last life I've been looking for you.
That innocent laugh led me here.
Even if every piece of you disappeared, or was scattered everywhere,
I won't waver, I'll start over,
taking million years, singing this song.

links: English version.
A translation I referred to and then avoided.

songs.preamble: Heike monogatari is an underrated anime. It's hard to recommend a large-scale operatic Japanese historical piece's anime adaptation. But its OP and the band it's by are easier to recommend. After writing this translation, though, I've realized that I'm probably not good enough. This is so much more beautiful than the English makes it seem. And you get the guitar riff. Also, I picked a very 'heike-monogatari'-first interpretation of this song -- the main character can see the future and I think it's her talking to the character who becomes her father-figure.

君がそれを諦めないからだよ
最終回のストーリーは初めから決まっていたとしても
今だけはここにあるよ 君のまま光ってゆけよ

あの花が落ちるとき その役目を知らなくても

今日を旅立つ準備はいいかい

ときに戸惑う 繰り返すんだ

ならば 全てを生きてやる

何回だって言うよ 世界は美しいよ
君がそれを諦めないからだよ
混沌の時代に 泥だらけの君のままで輝きを見つめていて
悲しみに向かう夜も 揺るがずに光っていてよ

いつか巡ってまた会おうよ
最終回のその後も
誰かが君と生きた記憶を語り継ぐでしょう

いつか笑ってまた会おうよ
永遠なんてないとしたら
この最悪な時代もきっと続かないでしょう

君たちはありあまる奇跡を
駆け抜けて今をゆく

english:
That that flower bloomed, was because the seed fell there
even as it withers, it'll make a seed and continue.

Your footsteps may change as you proceed
but you'll always suffer what you can always see.

Running through this wilderness
I'm only going going
Am I ready to travel to tomorrow?

I hesitate there but fate
is calling calling calling me
so I might as will live through it all.

You say it over and over that the world is beautiful.
You never give it up.
The end of this story was decided from the start but,
you're only here in the present so shine in your own way.

When that flower falls, even if it didn't know its purpose
it's because those around knew it.

The sea breeze cuts me a lot
going going as I breathe
am I ready to travel through today.

I hestitate at times looking back
calling calling I can hear
so I might as will live through it all.

You say it over and over that this world is beautiful
you never give that up.
In these messed up times, looking at you shining though muddied
unflailingly shining as you face sadness.

Let's hope we're blessed with one more meeting.
After the end
somebody will pass on your story.

Let's meet sometime smiling.
If there's no forever then
these worst times won't necessarily continue.

All these miracles that you all
Race through to get to now.

links: A Japanese guitarist youtuber being a fan of the band and song. I like the 'beautiful ephemeral worldliness' as he describes.
A hitsujibungaku performance.
I.. don't usually like such versions, but this. This is something. 本当に、普通、僕はこういいうアレンジ気に入らないけどこれは、、、違う。
A live performance of this song.
Another live performance, with en subs. We disagree on the subject sometimes because Japanese subjects you to that subjectivity.

songs.preamble:
この曲はなんか不思議でとっても悲しい曲かも。
For real, though, somehow, something in this song unerringly makes me sad. It's not just some momento mori, but more of the reflective side of looking back and noticing how far away the past is, may be.

english:
The 5pm bell tolls
good kids go home
the smell of dinner wafts.

In the corner of the bike parking
I saw that girl from the other day
she's a mother now she says.

The ever-changing future and
my lagging memories
always reveal
impermanence.

Bye, bye,
to the days that won't return.
The haphazard today is connected,
vague blank spaces all over,
unconsciously come up,
from far far away.

The distant smell of flora,
though it's so close,
but I don't see them now.

Even the things from now
I can more-or-less predict.
Over and over,
I fall off the rail.

Bye, bye,
to the days that I can't change.
As if with bubbles today is connected by,
vague blank spaces all over,
unconsciously come up.

Upon my sandcastle,
I pour some water,
harden it,
and stack it up.
It won't lose to anyone, become the top,
so tall nobody can keep up,
I'll build it up.
I'm out past the 5pm chime.

Bye, bye,
to the days that won't return.
The haphazard today is connected,
vague blank spaces all over,
unconsciously come up.
Bye, bye,
just like today,
the sun will rise and fall.
Bye, bye,
to the days that won't return,
in a blink of an eye, it goes
far, far, away.

links: The singer's page with the lyrics. Note that I divided up the lyrics by the pauses I can remember in the song.
